alert.note: Alert for South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 8:38PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHEASTERN SOCORRO COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM MDT... At 838 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles northwest of Carrizozo, moving south at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Carrizozo and Oscuro. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 42 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Upper Tularosa Valley
